title: Any kind soul willing to teach about Lee Sin?
body:
Recently bought Lee Sin, I main Mid and Support, I felt like going off-meta for a little while and bought Lee Sin {{champion:64}} mostly for a Mid role,  although I'm starting him off by playing him Jungle, to learn more about him. 
Are there any tips, any YouTube vids that might help me? Better yet, is there someone who is willing to add me in-game and teach me combo's/tips?

Negative comments encouraged, please tell me if I'm doing something wrong (mainly, using Lee Sin as a mid laner)

replies.body: lol trash trying to use lee sin mid? this is the most cringeworthy shit i have seen in awhile, just be a good pleb and learn easier mid laners like Diana/Fizz/Orianna

Thanks for the negative comment, but I was expecting criticisms, not pointless comments telling me what I already know.
First of all, pretty rude of you to come onto my post and call me trash
Second of all, please explain how it's cringe-worthy, I understand Lee Sin is a Top or Jungler, but what is so bad about Lee Sin mid?
He has plenty of roam potential so he's mid-worthy IMO.

Lee Sin is a situational mid laner, you aren't going to have a good time vs a decent Azir for example... he is all about getting an immense cs lead + kills... if you haven't fbed their jungler or mid pre6, or don't have a 15-45+ cs lead you are well and truly f*ked... 
lee sin mid is a great at shoving the lane and roaming, but if you fall behind vs the likes of Azir you will be restricted to your tower and at the mercy of your team... Lee mid A. needs his lanes to do well/very well.. B. get ungodly fed and end the game by 35 mins max.. or C. used to help reduce pressure for his late game hypercarry champs.. (Ryze top, Vayne adc, devourer Jax... )

The problem with lee sin as a midlaner, compared with top for example is that he doesn't have a way to trade equally with a lot of the popular picks right now. For example if a lux were to q auto w auto you, at lvl 1-5 you would lose half your hp with no way to fight back. Unless you q'd into her in which case she will shield auto harass you and kill you with ignite. Same goes for victor azir ect. The reason why you can play some melee such as riven and irelia mid is because they have a way of dealing damage in the safety of a stun and then quickly disengage. If you really wanted to play lee sin mid you would have to put a lot of points into your shield early.

You're thinking of him the wrong way I think. Lee Sin mid is all about the roaming potential. Like old Kassadin, where you would struggle through the laning phase, and then suddenly at level 6 become a god, get a double bot lane and snowball from there.

The way Lee Sin mid would work is, by playing very passive and waiting for the wave to reach your side of the lane. Zoning shouldn't be an issue, because generally in mid, zoning your opponent by standing in-front of minions is just asking for a first blood gank. Land Q's for trades whenever you can, but if an opportunity never shows, just use it to get those far away CS. Also now with the new TP mid meta, you could even take TP and have a free back in the laning phase, if you are being harassed too much.

At level 6 roam bot for an almost guaranteed kill or two. You will have better roams than any mid laner right now, due to your combination of mobility, CC and early game damage. 

The big issue with midlane Lee Sin is the late game fall off. Not even LeBlanc falls off as bad as Lee Sin does late game. This is terrible for a mid laner. It might be possible to transition in to a split-push strategy though, kind of like with Zed.

My thoughts exactly, though Felsummoner is correct about the trades, sure Lux can Q->AA->E->AA, but if I was able to dodge the Q, and landed a Q of my own, I could go in and potentially win the trade.
Lee Sin's damage falls off late-game, so I've thought about using him as a split-pusher/objective control champion if I play him mid. 
2-man baron's are possible late-game, I can solo dragon, or I can pressure objectives while my team is away doing other things.

Also, it would put psychological pressure on the enemies, as if I am pinged MIA, they may play much safer, because Lee covers the map pretty quickly with his Q and W.

The problem with Lee mid, is that if he's pressured too much by someone who can take towers easily, he won't have a chance to gank, otherwise his tower goes down.

Oh and a good idea while you're low elo is to not go off meta until you understand what you're doing in the game with the champ. You gotta know strengths weaknesses of your champ and all other opponents. Cringeworthy is seeing people go off meta picks. You'll never get better if you just do that. Keep lee sin in the jungle where he is most effective so you learn him the most popular/effective way until you get a hold of his balls
Watch gripex. Btw you probably shouldn't be playing high skillcap champs that NO ONE should play (think of the children!!) until plat/diamond. Example: lee sin

Gripex is my main inspiration, I understand I shouldn't go off-meta, but I don't believe there's anything wrong with playing high skill-cap champs, I mean, there's no law forbidding that right? I main Yasuo, and I think I'm pretty decent at him. 
I'd like to ask why you mentioned not to play Lee until I'm plat?

Pretty much because of mechanical skill, knowledge of the game and also the team I'm pretty sure. The highest I've gone is gold5 so I'm no plat but still. There's plenty of reasons you can think of.. Just don't play them in ranked until you can carry games anyway and be efficient. Like most people under gold will just try insec all the time and eventually fuck their own team up from kicking a fighter to your backline. Basically knowledge man

in bronze/silver/gold your team is likely to throw the lead you made for them..whereas for example in Challenger if Lee gets a kill for his Irelia/Ryze/Vayne they are likely to autowin the game off of that... once he gets his lanes ahead all he needs to do is read the map and show up for any counterganks.. or to further stomp their late game hypercarries... chances are in challenger a 40 cs lead cait with 1-2 kills is already going to make that other vaynes life hell... bronze players overstay or go for fights they shouldnt and lose their lead
